How do people decide for whom they will vote? Certainly many factors, from candidate characteristics to issue stances, play a role in shaping electoral outcomes. Using a data from a 2012 experiment among Boston commuters, I estimate the causal effect of exposure to Spanish speakers on attitudes toward immigration among registered voters in Georgia today.
